resources.string: Take a photo of yourself or your friend on camera, and analyze the mood
Analyze your or a friend\'s emotions in real time. More suitable for adjusting to your mood
Analyze your own or someone else\'s emotions using photos from your gallery.
For only 100 rubles a month you will use this application without hindrance, including the absence of annoying ads :)
For only 300 rubles a month you will get access to the following functions: analysis of mood by voice, complete disabling of ads, as well as statistics
Add your own note and photo. Suitable when you want to do everything yourself and customize it as much as possible.
Add emotion by answering the questions asked with voice and subsequent automatic recognition. It doesn\'t work perfectly, but sometimes it\'s easier and faster.
Take a simple questionnaire and we will determine your mood. If in doubt, this is the best way.
Give your (or someone else\'s) photo, and we will analyze what mood this person is.
When you miss a day, you don\'t keep any records! Try to come back here every day :)
If you want, write a note here
Enter the name of the lesson
Search for emotion by note / date …
You can define your mood (or another person\'s) and keep it
To make the recognition clearer, we recommend adding a photo with one person, where his face is clearly visible.
Here you can familiarize yourself with all the subscriptions, and, if you wish, issue them.
Try to answer with a few words, so that it would be easier for me to determine your mood
An error occurred, please try again later :(
You cannot go back to the previous question!
Questions 1–8 assessed the symptoms of depression.

If you scored more than 11 points, then this may indicate depression. In the case of depression, the person usually suffers from low mood, loss of interest and cheerfulness, decreased energy, which in turn leads to increased fatigue and decreased activity. People may also experience decreased attention and concentration, sleep disturbances, and changes in appetite. You can also experience feelings of guilt and inferiority, low self-esteem and self-confidence; a person may show pessimism and hopelessness in relation to the future, the will to live may diminish. If you are thinking about death, check out our quick help contacts and be sure to contact one of them so as not to be left alone!
Questions 9–14 assessed the symptoms of generalized anxiety neurosis.

If you scored more than 11 points, then this may indicate an anxiety neurosis. Generalized anxiety neurosis manifests itself in the form of generalized, constant, so to speak, unstable anxiety, which is not significantly associated with certain situations. The most common complaints are anticipatory anxiety and anxiety, nervousness, muscle tension, tension headache, tremors, fatigue, weakness, dry mouth and other signs of overactive autonomic nervous system, and it is also difficult for a person to relax.
Questions 15 and 16 assessed symptoms of social phobia, which is an anxiety disorder associated with communication.

If you scored more than 3 points, then this may indicate social anxiety. Social phobia is associated with the fear of being the center of attention in a small group. Often, social phobia is also associated with low self-esteem and fear of criticism. In phobic situations, people experience somatic anxiety symptoms such as redness, shaking hands, nausea, or heart palpitations, which are very uncomfortable, so people try to avoid various social situations.
Questions 17–20 assessed the symptoms of asthenia, that is, fatigue.

If you scored more than 6 points, then this may indicate fatigue syndrome, in which a person is exhausted both physically and mentally, and feels general fatigue, which cannot be significantly affected by rest. Low attention and the ability to concentrate are characteristic, and even after a little exertion, a person quickly gets tired.
Questions 21–23 assessed the symptoms of insomnia.

If you scored more than 6 points, then this may indicate a sleep disorder. Sleep disorders can manifest as difficulty falling asleep, restless intermittent sleep, and waking up too early. Sleep disorders can be associated with many other health problems.
Here you can choose what you \\n did from the suggested \\n options, or add your own \\n option, or \\n skip it altogether.
